website_summaries.verdict: A fondue-style butter warmer that comes in a cute set of two you can use at the table.
pros: Comes in a set of two
Melts your butter and keeps it warm
Gets hot,  even with a tea candle
cons: The bowls are a little on the small side

customer_reviews.title: These look good but. I was using them to keep drawn ...
customer_reviews.text: These look good but . I was using them to keep drawn butter warm while eating seafood however the design has the flame too far from the dish to keep it warm. It is better than using nothing meaning that the butter will not get cold as fast but its not enough heat or the heat/flame is too far from the bottom of the dish to keep butter warm. Wanted to love this product but it didn't get the job done.
customer_reviews.author: TravelMax

customer_reviews.title: Keeps butter warm, no popping or explosions
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for melted butter with lobster and clams. Still had nice warm liquid butter at the end of the meal when there would normally be a congealed mess. Tip: Pre-melt the butter then pour into the dish. These would take a while to melt it on their own. No popping or explosions like some reviews on other products that get too hot.
customer_reviews.author: hayley warshauer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!  Look no further!
customer_reviews.text: If you're shopping around looking for the perfect butter-warmer, look no further. At first glance, I thought the ramekin wasn't going to hold enough butter, but it holds plenty enough for two people to share one dish. The tea-light candles were just enough to keep butter warm, and did not leave any black soot marks on the cups. For an outdoor event, I take a little tin foil and wrap it around the base to keep the wind from blowing the candle out. These are great!
customer_reviews.author: Bill J.

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: So we started with two just to see if we liked them. We have used them for surf and turf (butter warmer) and it worked fantastic. We have also used it for a garlic butter mix and chocolate. It kept the butter melted without burning the garlic and it didn't burn the chocolate. So now we know they work we have to get enough for the dinner set. I hope you and your family will enjoy these as much as we have.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Jen

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Addition to Crab!
customer_reviews.text: We received a set of crab hammers and picks for Christmas and realized that we didn't have butter warmers and so bought these. Perfect. Butter stays warm and they complete our ability to have crab at home. The features ask if they can be given as a gift. Yes! They come in a set of two, nicely wrapped and nestled in a box just the right size for both of them. I am keeping them in the box for storage and the ability to take them to crab and lobster fests.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Really cute sat, a must for those who like to eat crab
customer_reviews.text: In theory this was a really great idea, I was having a low country boil and wanted to add this to my table, wound up not using the stands and just sticking the bowls in the microwave to melt the butter, the candles that came with it were all melty and nasty but with this Florida heat that's how I expected them to arrive. All around I love the set and I'm glad to have it as a part of my gadgets
customer_reviews.author: Lacy

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I bought these as a gift and they work perfectly. As with any open flame you need to be careful and do not leave it burning longer than needed to keep your sauce warm. If the butter etc starts to boil, well then you need to blow out the flame. Perfectly suited for it's intended purpose and the cups are a very generous size and has worked well for melted butter or au jus.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie

customer_reviews.title: We like lobster at home
customer_reviews.text: We like eating seafood at home including crab legs and lobster. I used to warm butter in the microwave in a small bowl. The butter cools almost immediately, hence the need for these butter warmers. Amazing how the small candle does melt and keep the butter warm through the whole meal. Bravo - Butter.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Awful item!
customer_reviews.text: We had 8 people for dinner on New Year's Eve serving Lobster tails in our dining room. We placed the butter in the ramekins and a guest lit the candles as we were preparing to sit down for dinner. Within 5 minutes, the butter was boiling, popping and spraying all over the table and linen place mats. It was horrible! We had to blow out the candles and use the butter with no heat. The ramekins are small, hold very little butter, and do not fit in the stands properly. Terrible purchase! DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.author: Patricia A Irish

customer_reviews.title: Nonfunctional Product.
customer_reviews.text: This is not a functional product. The distance between the tealight and the ceramic basin might as well be a meter apart; I can put my index finger between flame and the bottom of the cup without any discomfort. I've had the stock tealight burning for two hours now and a tablespoon of salted butter which is still in solid form, so I would definitely not recommend this to anyone. Tested in a non-drafty room at approximately 66-67 degrees farenheit.
